item.title: Hotfix #64 (1.7.2) - Patch Notes
item.description:
Hey Everyone,
Hotfix #64 (1.7.2) is currently rolling out across our platforms. In the meantime, you can read the notes below.

General Fixes
  • Fixed instances of small amounts of analogue stick movement taking control over mouse and keyboard.
  • Fixed implementation of dead zone threshold on the right gamepad stick.
  • Fix for a crash that may occur while presenting the Havoc information at the end of the mission screen.
  • Fixed a bug where Assail Shards were not visible when spectating another player.
  • Fixed an issue where aimed Assail shards lost their target after throwing them.
  • Available Mastery points are now evaluated against the total amount of points needed to acquire all blessings. The player may still hold more points than needed, but the UI will not acknowledge it and show 0 as the value for the available remaining points in those cases.
  • Fixed issue where the equipped weapon was not the first one being selected when opening the weapon selection in the inventory or crafting.
  • Fixed Surety of Arms talent giving peril when reloading above the threshold.
  • Fixed a bug where Warp Unbound would not prevent players from overloading at the end of Scrier's Gaze.
Mortis Trial Fixes and Tweaks
  • Pacing and difficulty for Mortis Trials - Tweaked enemy compositions to slightly increase difficulty.
    • Increased the amount of minions spawned for waves 7/8/9/10/11/12 to make the waves feel more dense.
    • Added more minion types for wave 12, increasing the difficulty slightly according to the player power spike.
    • Decreasing timer for all waves. It shortened the pacing overall, making waves faster and more intense.
Dev Note: Please let us know how it feels after these changes and we‚Äôll continue to monitor feedback.¬†
  • Fixed a potential crash that could occur during scanning objectives in Mortis Trial.
  • The UI for the Mortis trials now behaves as expected if a player joins mid-session.
  • Fixed an issue where the wrong objective text was shown during scanning events in Mortis Trial.
  • The ‚ÄúHold Your Ground‚Äù objective in Mortis Trials now shows the objective marker towards the area if you are outside of it, regardless of other players already being inside.
  • Fixed minor Level Art bugs.
  • Awarded Trinkets now display as expected in the notification panels.
  • The Mortis receiver machine in the lobby was lit up by default, but it has been fixed so that it only lights up after receiving the Mortis relic.
  • Changed out Sefonis' pictures on the cogitators in the lobby as well as in the posters on the levels.
  • Fixed issue where players would no longer receive buffs if they were dead and were supposed to select a buff in the Mortis trials.
  • Fixed a place in Mortis Trial where players could not¬† get attacked by melee enemies.
  • Fixed a bug where players died while teleporting while bringing back the Relic, which would cause the server to crash.
Cosmetic Fixes
  • Fixed a black patch on the right arm of the Zealot ‚ÄúVostroyan Flak Coat with Chainmail‚Äù upperbody cosmetic.
  • Fixed instances where part of the characters face would appear missing while wearing the following Ogryn headgear cosmetics.
  • Vostroyan Hat with a Chainmail Hood (Tundra Soil, XXXXL)
  • Vostroyan Hat with a Chainmail Hood (Rust Patches, XXXXL)
  • Vostroyan Chainmail Hood (XXXXL)
  • Amended the ‚ÄúObtain From‚Äù text on the ‚ÄúThe World‚Äôs A Stage‚Ä¶‚Äù cosmetic insignia to now show the relevant event.
  • Amended the ‚ÄúObtain From‚Äù text on the ‚ÄúPlasma Canister‚Äù weapon trinket to show the correct source of the item.

item.title: March Community Update
item.description:
Greetings Brothers and Sisters,

Many announcements have taken place throughout March. Let‚Äôs rewind a bit, and then let‚Äôs dive into the upcoming content! We‚Äôll also tackle the polls taken to make the Absolute Difficulty more to your liking.


MONTH‚ÄôS REWIND

We‚Äôve made a huge announcement ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Mid-March, we announced that Space Marine 3 had begun development and we‚Äôre excited to see your enthusiasm, although we hear those of you who fear for Space Marine 2 and its future support.

So let us set the record straight: Space Marine 3 does not mean the end of Space Marine 2's development. ‚ÄãFar from it. No teams are shifting over, no one is abandoning the game, and our plans to bring more awesome content to Space Marine 2 remain. We are working on much more content and surprises for the months to come, such as a new class, more operations, melee weapons, and more! Trust us, there are surprises even dataminers haven‚Äôt found out about :)

This announcement simply marks the genesis of a new project, years away from release. We‚Äôve made a decision and have just started the process.

Many of you were very excited for this project and this makes us incredibly happy and motivated. Thank you for the unwavering support.


That being said, we still have a lot to offer to the players with Space Marine 2.


We launched the PTS on March 13!

The Public Test Server was made available mid-march and you‚Äôve been very dedicated and serious about it!



We‚Äôve opened a forum on Focus Together to let you voice your opinion on the content featured in the PTS. Even if we might not have enough time on our hands to reply to every thread, we‚Äôre collecting your thoughts and making adjustments on our side. So, thank you!

We already started to compile your feedback, and we‚Äôll implement some of them directly on a PTS update that will come early April.

Regarding your feedback on the PTS features, we want to tackle the most important one here:

  • Prestige Perks are not gamechanger, they are too weak and not worth the effort.
üí¨ Prestige Perks have not been conceived as game breaking perks meant to allow you to roll on late game content. Another way to say it is that we don‚Äôt want the Prestige Perks to be so strong they become ‚Äúmust-haves‚Äù for higher difficulties. We really want to emphasize that you don‚Äôt need Prestige Perks to beat Absolute difficulty. This would make grinding for them an obligation when we really want them as minor rewards for those who choose to pursue them. The idea behind Prestige Perks is to provide you with more replayability, so you actually have a purpose farming PvE content (other than purging for the Imperium of course!). We don't want players to feel like they need to base their builds upon prestige perks, otherwise it will feel like a forced grind.

Don‚Äôt forget that there‚Äôs a unique cosmetic for each class to unlock once you maxed out a class.

  • Prestige Ranks are resetting the class progression to level 1, it will be tedious and too long to get level 25 again.
üí¨ In recent updates we've increased the amount of xp players are getting in preparation for the prestige system. We've added extermination bonus, quick match bonus, plus new difficulties grant more xp.

On top of that we‚Äôll add an XP bonus to make your post-prestige progression faster.

Again, we are trying to strike the balance between having something to keep playing and not forcing players to grind for a hundred hours.

  • The Prestige Perks for the Heavy Class are too centered around melee combat.
üí¨ We are working on changes regarding the Heavy‚Äôs Prestige Perks to better integrate them for Heavy‚Äôs builds.

  • Assault should have access to the Inferno Pistol!
üí¨ Absolutely, that‚Äôs why we‚Äôll include the weapon to Assault‚Äôs options starting from the next PTS update.

Join the players on Discord if you want to chat about this PTS and the future instances!

‚Äé
‚åõ Patch 7.0 - Trygon Update

Patch 7.0 will be released in mid-April on all platforms. Let‚Äôs dissect the content together!

New DLC content

Space Wolves Chapter Pack üê∫
‚Äã ‚Äã ‚Äã

‚Äã
Behold the arsenal tied to this Chapter:‚Äã
‚Äã
The Space Wolf Chapter Pack comes with its Great Companies. See below:



Imperial Fists Champion Pack ‚úä

‚Äã
‚Äã
New Map for PvE üèúÔ∏è

The new Exfiltration map is coming with Patch 7.0! As the name of the update hints, you will meet with a terrible new boss: the Trygon.

The Trygon is a giant Tyranid creature that can burrow itself in the ground and carve underground tunnels that can be used by smaller Tyranids to bypass the defense lines and coordinate surprise attacks.

‚ÄúExfiltration‚Äù takes place on Avarax. Your mission is to exfiltrate a Tech-Priest occupying an Adeptus Mechanicus facility on the planet. However, you‚Äôll have to cross a Trygon territory to reach the facility. You‚Äôll have to deal with the relentless assaults of the creature to complete your mission.
‚Äã


Speaking of PvE, as discussed before in the PTS section, more features will be tweaked. Prestige Ranks will become unlockable, and weapon class restrictions will be adjusted, allowing classes to access more weapons. Additionally, PvE matchmaking will be improved, reducing the chances of joining a team with the same class.

Regarding PvP ‚öîÔ∏è

Patch 7.0 will bring Private Lobbies to PvP! Also, we made matchmaking improvements for better team balancing.

Private Lobbies will give you the opportunity to customise your PvP experience, with many adjustable options! You‚Äôll be able to:
  • tag with up to 11 other players (6v6 lobbies)
  • toggle friendly fire
  • change the class limit restriction
  • change the score/time limit
  • modify the damage multipliers of the weapons
  • ‚Ä¶ and more!
General additions ‚ûï
  • Weapons Perks Rework (details here)
  • New Colors available in the Armouring Hall: Volupus Pink and Thousand Sons Blue

  • Cloth coloring for Bulwark and hoods (every class).
  • Option to color hands separately from arms
  • Also, the Inferno Pistol will now be available to Assault, Vanguard, Sniper and Heavy Class players, both in PvP and PvE!

‚Äã ‚Äã ‚Äã ‚Äã
Cannot wait until the release in April? Try it on the PTS ‚öôÔ∏è

You can try patch 7.0‚Äôs WIP content early if you‚Äôre playing on Steam! Only thing you need to do is to install the Public Test Server. Here‚Äôs a quick tutorial on how to do it. We promise it‚Äôs easy!

You can already read the changelog of Patch 7.0 here.

üÜô March Community Event

From March 24 to 30th, XP rewards for both Operations and Eternal war are increased by 25%.
So head back to the battlefield, it‚Äôs time to put in the work.


You won‚Äôt need PROS for this Event.

üí° Ideas on Focus Together

We see your ideas and are doing our best to give them a status and leave comments when we can. However, they remain extremely numerous so please be patient, and remember that we will mainly tackle ideas that have been upvoted with the most G2G points.

üîñ Results of the Absolute Difficulty polls

First of all, we want to kindly thank you for your input! We‚Äôre working hard to improve the game and make it to the players‚Äô liking. The Absolute Difficulty, as expressed in the previous Community Update, was tough to balance, so we‚Äôre grateful for your inputs.

Let‚Äôs see the results!

  • You‚Äôve voted for more enemies on Absolute Difficulty. With a total of 74.64% votes for and 25.36% against.

  • You‚Äôve voted against augmenting the Ammo refills limitations. With a total of 24.75% votes for and 75.25% against.

  • You‚Äôve voted for more enemy aggressiveness. With a total of 70.47% votes for and 29.53% against.

  • You‚Äôve voted against increasing enemy health and damage. With a total of 15.84% votes for and 84.15% against.
Your feedback on both the Absolute Difficulty poll and PTS content is well taken. We are planning to make some careful changes in Patch 8.0.

That‚Äôs it for this month! As always, we want to thank you for your dedication and your passion! Seeing your feedback and comments on the game really drives us to deliver more and more content. Space Marine 2 wouldn‚Äôt be the game it is now without you, and we‚Äôre far from finished with this title!


The Emperor Protects!

The Saber & Focus teams

item.title: Hotfix 6.1.1
item.description:
Hi folks,

We've just rolled out Hotfix 6.1.1, which primarily addresses an issue that was causing a crash on some modded campaigns.

  • Fixed crash related to loading files in mods containing uppercase characters in their names
  • Fixed issue where game was being flagged as modded when no mods were enabled
We aim to be back next week with Hotfix 6.1.2, which will include fixes for the Known Issues detailed in our Patch 6.1 Release Notes.

We're also aware that some players are encountering graphical issues when using their RTX 50 series graphics cards. For those users, please update your GPU drivers to the latest version using the Nvidia app, Geforce Experience or directly on Nvidia's website. If you continue to experience issues, please report them in our bug reporting sub-forum.

See you on the battlefield!

‚Äî The Total War Team

‚ö† IMPORTANT

If you experience any issues after downloading the update, please take a moment to Verify the integrity of the game files first to ensure there were no issues when downloading. A step-by-step guide can be found in this article.

If the issues persist, please visit our support site for additional troubleshooting steps and assistance.

üß± MOD WARNING

Please note that user-generated mods may have compatibility issues with new game updates. If you are encountering performance or stability issues following a release, is recommended that you disable any mods you're running. If you continue to experience issues, please visit our support site for additional troubleshooting steps and assistance.

item.title: Hotfix #63 (1.7.1)
item.description:
Hey Everyone,
Hotfix #63 is currently rolling out across our platforms and it'll be available soon!

General Fixes
  • [Known Issue] Fixed a bug that was causing the client to crash when they reached max capacity of stacks given by the Psyker's Mettle Talent.
  • Fixed a bug where the Psyker's Mettle Talent was being activated by critical attacks that did not hit any enemies.
  • Fixed a rare crash that might occur when using the Ogryn Loyal Protector talent.
Mortis Trial Fixes
  • Fixed a bug that caused certain enemy types to not be included in waves 10+ in the Theatre of Castigation.
  • Fixed an issue in Mortis Trials where a dead player could get stuck on either of the two islands if the group did not resurrect them before taking the portal back to Sefoni.
  • Fixed an issue in Mortis Trials where players could leave the intended gameplay area.
  • Fixed an issue in Mortis Trials where a player could end up being stuck in a container after being rescued from a hang ledge.
  • Fixed issue with joining an ongoing game of Mortis Trials when an objective is completed.
  • We increased the amount of Plasteel for completing Mortis Trials in all difficulties. This was the result of a bug not giving the right amount and we also feel it was too little overall for the time spent completing a mission of Mortis Trials.
